homework1

Class CardCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • homework1.CardCollection

  • public class CardCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    The CardCollection class implements an abstract data type for a list of baseball cards supporting some common operations on such lists.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CardCollection()
      Construct an instance of the CardCollection class with no BaseballCard objects in it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCard(BaseballCard newCard)
      Adds a new BaseballCard object to the end of the list
      void addCard(BaseballCard newCard, int position)
      Adds a new BaseballCard object to a specified position
      boolean exists(BaseballCard card)
      Check whether this collection contains the given card
      BaseballCard getCard(int position)
      Get the BaseballCard at the given position in this CardCollection object.
      void printAllCards()
      Prints a neatly formatted table of each item in the collection on its own line with its position number as shown in the sample output.
      void removeCard(int position)
      Removes the BaseballCard object at the specified position in the CardCollection
      int size()
      Determines the number of items currently in this collection.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Gets the String representation of this CardCollection object, which is a neatly formatted table of each BaseballCard in the CardCollection on its own line with its position number as shown in the sample output.
      void trade(CardCollection other, int myPosition, int theirPosition)
      Exchange a card from this collection for a card from another collection.

        Construct an instance of the CardCollection class with no BaseballCard objects in it.
        Postcondition:

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Determines the number of items currently in this collection.
        Precondition:
        This CardCollection object has been instantiated.
        Returns:
        The number of BaseballCards in this CardCollection.

      • addCard

        public void addCard(BaseballCard newCard,
           int position)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    FullCollectionException
        Adds a new BaseballCard object to a specified position
        Parameters:
        newCard - the new BaseballCard object to add to this collection
        position - the position in this CardCollection where newCard will be inserted
        Precondition:
        This CardCollection object has been instantiated and 1 < position < items_currently_in_list + 1. The number of BaseballCard objects in this Menu is less than MAX_CARDS.
        Postcondition:
        The new BaseballCard is now stored at the desired position in the CardCollection. All cards that were originally in positions greater than or equal to position are moved back one position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Indicates that position is not within the valid range.
        FullCollectionException - Indicates that there is no more room inside of the CardCollection to store the new BaseballCard object.

      • addCard

        public void addCard(BaseballCard newCard)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    FullCollectionException
        Adds a new BaseballCard object to the end of the list
        Parameters:
        newCard - the new BaseballCard object to add to this collection
        Precondition:
        This CardCollection object has been instantiated. The number of BaseballCard objects in this Menu is less than MAX_CARDS.
        Postcondition:
        The new BaseballCard is now stored at the end of the CardCollection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Indicates that position is not within the valid range.
        FullCollectionException - Indicates that there is no more room inside of the CardCollection to store the new BaseballCard object.

      • removeCard

        public void removeCard(int position)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the BaseballCard object at the specified position in the CardCollection
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the card in this CardCollection that will be removed
        Precondition:
        This CardCollection object has been instantiated and 1 < position < items_currently_in_list
        Postcondition:
        The card at the desired position in the collection has been removed. All cards that were originally in positions greater than or equal to position are moved forward one position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Indicates that position is not within the valid range.

      • getCard

        public BaseballCard getCard(int position)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get the BaseballCard at the given position in this CardCollection object.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the card in this CardCollection that will be received
        Precondition:
        This CardCollection object has been instantiated and 1 < position < items_currently_in_list
        Returns:
        The card at the specified position in this Menu object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Indicates that position is not within the valid range.

      • trade

        public void trade(CardCollection other,
         int myPosition,
         int theirPosition)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  FullCollectionException
        Exchange a card from this collection for a card from another collection.
        Parameters:
        other - the CardCollection we will be trading with
        myPosition - the position within this collection of the card to trade
        theirPosition - the position within the other collection of the card to trade
        Precondition:
        Both CardCollection objects have been instantiated and 1 < myPosition < items_currently_in_this_list and 1 < theirPosition < items_currently_in_other_list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Indicates that either position is not within the valid range.
        FullCollectionException

      • exists

        public boolean exists(BaseballCard card)
        Check whether this collection contains the given card
        Parameters:
        card - the BaseballCard we are looking for
        Precondition:
        This CardCollection and the BaseballCard object have both been instantiated
        Returns:
        True, if this CardCollection contains the card, false otherwise.

      • printAllCards

        public void printAllCards()
        Prints a neatly formatted table of each item in the collection on its own line with its position number as shown in the sample output.
        Precondition:
        This CardCollection object has been instantiated
        Postcondition:
        A neatly formatted table of each card in the collection on its own line with its position number has been displayed to the user.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gets the String representation of this CardCollection object, which is a neatly formatted table of each BaseballCard in the CardCollection on its own line with its position number as shown in the sample output.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The String representation of this CardCollection object.
